title: Listening to the call of the wild
body:
**We hear the call of the wild. The Gratitude Blooming Podcast gives voice to that deep connection we have to nature. We are at a tipping point. Do we slip back into the shadows of fear? Or do we emerge with greater hope and a shifting consciousness.** 

Co-hosted by Belinda Liu and Omar Brownson, each week we share stories from the frontlines of this new landscape. Teachers, healers, leaders and so many others will join us to share their emergent practices. The stories become the map we create together across our lives and even into the metagarden.Â Â 

For our second season, the theme is Collective Acceleration. As a new business model for podcasting, we will drop a new piece of digital art, an NFT, with each episode. Collecting them is how you can support our podcast and movement. 

Thank you to all of our listeners who have helped to make the Gratitude Blooming Podcast one of the top 10 percent of podcasts in the world, ranked in the top 10 gratitude podcasts in Apple Podcasts with all 5 stars.

title: Day two in the incubation program
body:
**Todays work - I have started hunting ghosts**

Over a very short period I have received so much information. I spent the first hour today structuring the minutes from my first meetings to avoid information overload and to avoid missing out on any important details.

I also spent time going through tutorials, reading documentation etc.

Started the very first mapping of opening a Vault.I use <https://app.diagrams.net/> for this, asÂ  it is public available information only.

The purpose of this mapping is to:

1. Get to know MakerDAO and how it works
2. Identify risks regulatory risks along the way
3. Create documentation for an internal risk assessment
4. Create documentation for a regulator pitch-deck that will make it easier to explain how the product works and why MakerDAO/CUs are not covered by regulation.

This takes time but it can reduce the risk of seeing ghosts - and nobody wants to see ghostsâ€¦
Seeing a ghost can delay a process, make team members nervous without any reason or even change the design of a product that did not need changing.

**Prioritization of time is hard in a DAO**

Because MakerDAO wants to be transparent about what is going on, there are so many available meetings to attend. At the same time there are a lot of discussions going on in the forum.

When working for a DAO there is nobody to prioritize the time for me - I like that alot.

However, It takes some consideration to decide which calls to attend and what forum posts to read.

So far I decided to participate in the following stakeholder calls:

* Resiliency initiative
* Governance calls
* Voter committee/endgame calls
* RWF Office Hours (added 3 June 22)
* Quarterly Strategy Review (added 3 June 22)
* GovAlpha Office Hours (added 3 June 22)

Please let me know if you think this prioritization is wrong.

**My initial thoughts after participating in some calls**

There is probably room for improvement in relation to MakerDAOs stakeholder relationship management. It is still too early to conclude anything yet.

**We need a list with definitions in MakerDAO**

A lot of definitions are used, I needed a list of definitions.

Thanks to Retro for sharing this:

[https://manual.makerdao.com/makerdao/overview/acronyms](https://manual.makerdao.com/makerdao/overview/acronyms)

**Shout out to Lenka from SES!**

I had a cup of coffee with Lenka today, we talked a bit about Paris/EthCC and about the upcoming meetup she helps arrange here in Denmark.

For several years I have been attending the meetings Lenka is part of arranging - they are so well organized and draw a lot of attention.

These meetups helps people new to the crypto economy understand the basics.

For the OGs there is a lot of networking going on. The meetups are actually currently being recorded by two documentarians from the Danish National TV-Station called DR, they are producing a documentary movie about crypto currency.

For instance, I met Thomas Bisballe who is one of the founders of PozzlePlanet at one of the meetups.

PozzlePlanet is a DAO that helps clean the planet through gamification/play-to-earn.

They recently raised money with a NFT-model that was new to me.

See Pozzle Planet here:

[https://twitter.com/PozzlePlanet?s=20&t=JACRZqJqn4C3ZNILomReVg](https://twitter.com/PozzlePlanet?s=20&t=JACRZqJqn4C3ZNILomReVg)

And how they raised money here:

[https://pozzleplanet.medium.com/preview-how-to-invest-in-poz-by-buying-a-power-astro-nft-e390268e3f1](https://pozzleplanet.medium.com/preview-how-to-invest-in-poz-by-buying-a-power-astro-nft-e390268e3f1)

**Todays boring stuff**

And the boring stuff zzz. When I joined the incubation program I founded a LLC, there are a lot of formalities that need to be taken care of.

**What I could use some help with**

I need to make sure I am mapping all products/flows - a list of all MakerDAOs products would be great, to make sure I am not missing anything.

I am also looking for mapping of MakerDAOs organization in Sobol.io, does this exist?

**Distortion!**

This afternoon I am off to join Distortion! Distortion is a huge street party with a focus on electronic music, going on every year in June. The venue is in the small streets of Copenhagen, so the sad thing is that it ends early, like 8 pm or something.

title: The Work Metaverse white paper
body:
Todayâ€™s work market lacks efficiency because of high transaction costs and frequent conflicts of interests between the employer and the employee.

The Work Metaverse (the WoM) proposes a new paradigm that would lower transaction costs and reinvent the employment relationship, bridging the gap between traditional
corporations and DAOs.

The WoM does that by introducing digital identities for both employer and employee and offering an innovative engagement reward system that would align their interests.

title: hello world - a DAO for DAOs to bootstrap product & community
body:
### The Funding Cooperative DAO: unleashing the collective power of founders

*TL;DR - founders need to come together to balance power dynamics with sources of capital and to make real the world we all imagine. We can do that through some basic DeFi applied to DAO formation - instead of â€œjustâ€ creating a token to govern one DAO, what if we linked arms and built a token and a DAO amongst many of us? How could this pattern become a primitive used by many web3 communities to balance the forces, increase founder support and diversification, and fund the growth of a much larger and more inclusive web3?Â  This is our mission at the Funding Cooperative DAO and our first group of DAOs is launching shortly on Juicebox, arm in arm -> join us now.*Â 

**Introduction:**

There has been a lot of talk about the power dynamic shifting towards founders during the heights of the current macroeconomic cycle.

Funding is up, company formation is up, most importantly the number of engaged developers is up, and valuations *were* upâ€¦.Â 

![Follow the developers](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nEfQ7dnk7jkaVuyPwwuev.png?height=620&width=1416)

And now the cycle is turned. As the tide recedes we are going to learn a lot about how resilient the web2 economy really is. And countless founders are going to find that to their investors, they are just one of many investments. The start-up that to a founder feels like a reflection of their deepest purpose - may become a victim of triage in a venture fundâ€™s emergency ward, left in the hallway as nature takes its course.

web3 is supposed to be different. Built on the foundation of resilient, distributed, open-source, and autonomous systems such as Ethereum and communities that proudly disregard the status, privilege, and gatekeeping of the traditional economy - surely we will prosper even as the web2 economy undergoes another bout of â€˜creative destruction.â€™

And yet what about our foundations?Â  How solid are our foundations?Â Â 

Specifically - founders.Â  How can we collectively find and support more founders, the true basis of all innovation?Â  How are we treating them web3? It isnâ€™t as pretty as we might all think.

**Builders want to build:**Â Â 

In the words of a prolific builder and Funding Cooperative DAO member who has launched a number of projects:Â 

> â€œI donâ€™t want to answer questions like â€˜wen token?â€™Â  At least not yet.Â  I donâ€™t want to spend one second thinking about â€˜token go up.â€™ I donâ€™t want to hire a lawyer, do a funding deck, and see the power seeping from the developers to the investors. I want to build.â€ 
  
 These words echo what we have heard in many interviews over the last several months. And they resemble the experience of many of us in helping to found and foster open source projects back in our web2 days. Despite the ever-growing number of projects that help in DAO formation and management and the success of projects like GitCoin and SeedCamp, builders are not yet founding web3 projects at anything close to the pace we all would like to see.Â Â 

Here are a few statistics about the relative scale of web3 - so far:

* 2021 was a year of crypto and web3 hype - and yet according to data from Crunchbase, only 5% of venture deals were in the web3 space.Â Â 
* Deep Dao as of May 2022, only lists 91 DAOs with over $1 million assets under management - and approximately 50% of the total AUM is concentrated in only three DAOs.Â Â 
* As pointed out by A16Z in their recent state of crypto report, the AUM of all of DeFi would rank as the 31st largest bank in the United States.
* On average there were just over 15,000 businesses receiving an employer ID number just in the United States each day. These are employers that are likely to actually employ someone as opposed to S corps which are individual companies - there are many more of these.Â  By comparison there are only 4,834 projects listed on DeepDao.Â Â 

There are 3x more â€œnormie companiesâ€ founded in the US in a day than there are DAOs in existence.Â Â 

We have a long, long way to go for web3 to become the favored home of founders and especially of those that are technology-focused.Â  
 Here are some of the DAO founder pain points that we are building to solve:

* Diversification:Â 
  * â€œMy DAO contributors - and investors - have their fingers in many pies.Â  Iâ€™m all-in over here at this DAO.Â  What happens to me and my co-founders if it only does ok?â€Â 
  * â€œWe wanted to diversify our treasury but a) liquidity remains low so sales crush the price and b) the token holders are short-term focused, they want â€˜token go upâ€¦.So they shoot down our proposals and push us to hype more and HUDL HUDL HUDL.â€
* Loneliness:
  * We all have imposter syndrome.Â  And we all have experienced, some of us more than others, gaslighting by investors and others who would profit if only you saw the world their way and acquiesced to their strategies. While web3 vibes are generally positive and welcoming, founders told us that there are few safe places to talk about DAO growth and challenges with others that are at a similar stage in their founding journey.Â Â 
* Power law and the very few chances founders have to win:
  * Those of us that think in terms of economics and finance are all too aware of the power-law nature of returns in traditional venture capital.Â  It turns out that all of the returns to venture capital investors are contributed by the top several percent of companies. Returns to founders are even more skewed, meaning the vast majority of founders would have been better off if they had taken a reasonably well-paying job.Â 
  * If each start-up takes 4-5 years for a committed founder, they may only have 4-5 potential start-ups in their life. On the other side of the table, venture capitalists always already have dozens of companies in their portfolios. Given that - which side of the table is more likely to experience the transformative impact of a top 1% or .1% company?Â  And how does that reinforce centralization?

**Helping builders through a DAO of DAOs and a DAO of DAOs of DAOs?**

Our approach is pretty simple.Â  DAOs of DAOs.Â  Nested DAOs.Â  And diversification.Â Â 

Letâ€™s gain diversification, community, support, and a higher likelihood of a massive outcome by using some web3 primitives to create a shared DAO amongst a portfolio of DAOs. And letâ€™s form a DAO - we call it the Funding Cooperative DAO - to recruit, select, launch and support those portfolios.Â Â 

The DAO of DAOs consists of several - up to perhaps 30 - DAOs that have passed through diligence.Â  Through tokenswaps and other primitives, we seed for them a DAO that is jointly owned by them.Â  We also call this the â€œcohort DAOâ€ as a working title.Â  Each cohort DAO represents a season of DAOs that have joined the Funding Cooperative.

The Funding Cooperative DAO is a DAO of DAOs of DAOs.Â  â€œFC DAOâ€ exists to improve the processes before, during, and after the creation of the cohort DAOs.Â  Concretely this means we are building:

* A better graph to recruit web2 and web3 builders to think about founding DAOs - emphasizing outreach to underrepresented groups and partnering with many others in the web3 ecosystem with a similar mission
* Customized to purpose token swap primitives, building on existing token swaps
  * While one to one token swaps are a solved problem, we are extending these to many to one and one to many swaps, all performed atomicallyÂ 
* Customized to purpose index solutions, using Juicebox and tokensetsÂ 
  * For example, when and how can redemption play a role given that early-stage projects do not have liquid tokens
* Customized to purpose token creation and launch processes - mostly using Juicebox plus some related automation so far
  * Thank you to the Juicebox crew for all that they do!
* Partnerships with many existing communities that nurture DAOs, including MovementDAO and others, as places where members of cohort DAOs can thrive; we work together with partners on all phases of the cohort DAO life cycle from recruitment to formation and growth

**Ok DAO of DAOs of DAOs: â€œwen token?â€**

If you have read this far along, thank you!Â  Here are a few ways you can participate immediately.

First, join the Funding Cooperative DAO.Â  Drop-in to our [Discord](https://discord.gg/vUGcJrqh3Q) and say hi. Everyone who joins and helps out in a substantial way will receive an airdrop; also we have basic payment rails set up and will be selecting core contributors in the weeks to come. As an example, one of your first quests could be helping to execute an OP-inspired retroactive community airdrop: Merkle tree FTW!Â  We have a number of software projects underway or kicking off and we are building out our own DAO structure as well.Â  Engineers and DAO operators are especially in need.Â Â 

Secondly, soon we will be talking about the participation of several amazing DAOs. In contributing to one of us you are contributing to all of us. We will have a series of blogs and tweets about each of these DAOs in the days to come. Stay tuned and stay hyped.Â Â 

Third, builders apply and suggest other builders!Â  Our process for review is increasingly automated - within a day or two, we will give you directional feedback.Â  Basically, we are looking for technical depth and demonstrated trustworthiness, we are not trying to be gatekeepers as much as we are a mechanism for trustworthy technical DAO founders to link arms and bootstrap together the diversification, liquidity, and community we all need.

Apply now!Â  <https://tally.so/r/m68JLe>Â Â 

Our vision is of a world in which web3 helps address age-old challenges to innovation, including centralization of capital, gatekeeping of opportunity, and founder stress and insecurity.Â  We think the Funding Cooperative DAO can play a small role - that grows over time with your help - in making web3 the center of innovation for decades to come.Â  Letâ€™s work together to build a DAO that helps invent the future we all want to see.Â Â 

**

title: End of the first week
body:
**My observation of group dynamics when talking about work**

Today I participated in SESâ€™ weekly meeting.

First a bit of small talk, then a lightning round where everyone on the SES team is telling what they are currently working on. It seems like a way of doing a weekly group-check in. 

Pros (my personal opinion) 

* it is nice to catch up, seeing real faces and talking with colleagues is just great. 
* It is enlightening to get an idea of what is going on on a CU-level, and
* it is interesting to hear what everyone is working on.

Cons (my personal opinion - I have to be very careful here ğŸ˜…)

* If the lightning round is used as an accountability instrument, it is in my opinion not very well suited for that purpose. If a person attending the meeting is currently not that busy, this person risks putting him or herself at stake, and will risk looking redundant to the team/leader - this makes everyone want to sound busy and express why they are working on the most important thing in the World. I have to stress, that this is a very general assessment I make here, and it was not the case for any of the participants in this meeting! 

I have participated in similar meetings for years as an attorney and as a regulator, and I will probably end up introducing it in the CU I will be facilitating as well - I wonder if there is a better alternative?

**My work today**

I went through the DAO Resilience Improvement Strategic Initiative.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=621TKT6e0n8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=621TKT6e0n8)

It resonates with my view on prioritization, identifying the critical path is so important.

I share the opinion that this must be done by starting out with the problems, risks, and challenges and working out solutions from there.

As I understand it from Wouter and Retro, the problems must be identified from forum posts, MIPs, Discord chats, etc. Getting an aggregated overview, grouping problems, etc. sounds like a great start.

However, I also believe the person who will later be trying to solve the problem has to enter into a conversation with the people behind the forum posts before being able to actually understand the problem.

I find Clayton M Christensenâ€™s book Competing Against Luck comprehensive on how this kind of conversation/analysis can be conducted. 

[https://www.amazon.com/Competing-Against-Luck-Innovation-Customer/dp/0062435612](https://www.amazon.com/Competing-Against-Luck-Innovation-Customer/dp/0062435612)

I know itâ€™s easier said than done. And it would take a lot of time.

If an aggregated problem scoreboard is being built, my suggestion is to make sure the discord handle, email address, and name are always referred to, so the people behind the initial post can be identified and reached out in case of a conversation is needed at a later stage.

**Thanks so much for the feedback!**

I had some great feedback on my two first posts. This made me make some changes to the posts - thanks so much for helping me out ğŸ™Œ

title: Asymptote: a tale of eternity.
body:
A long time ago, there was a being that traveled through the space from pole to pole, even knowing that it was infinite. Her name was Asymptote. Her life was an eternal search, because it was based on finding the guides of what she believed was the most important thing in her existence.

One day, when she was searching between Andromeda and The Milky Way, she found something very interesting. Some sidereal beings that were prowling through the space were returning from what was known as an Axis. They explained to Asymptote that this axis was a very important element for understanding the Universe, which would be discovered much later by beings called humans. The representation of that element was only seen by those who had an incredible ability to question its existence. And, as it was not for wonder, Asymptote lived her life on that questioning.

Asymptote was dazzled by that discovery. The sidereal beings explained to her that that drawn Axis had been an imaginary projection of the Universe. They warned Asymptote that the Designer of the Universe had not defined if it would ever have an established purpose, so that they only appeared when He arranged for them to carry out some maintenance work on that axis. Asymptote without any hint of doubt, she hastened to answer that, since she was infinite in the Universe, she would begin the search for that end not determined by that lazy Designer. The sidereal beings only exchanged glances and drew a knowing smile.

Without further setbacks Asymptote began to sail towards the axis that was drawn very close from that astral point. Her smile was huge, she had never met anyone else like her. Someone infinite. Of course, she was forbidden to go to the end of the Universe. When the Designer of the Universe created her, she had outright forbidden it, because if she did not comply with that mandate, that Designer would put an end without discussion to her eternity. But Axis was different, it was only a few light years away, from her perspective. Little by little, Asymptote began to accelerate. Her speed increased as her emotions did. She was about to hit the speed of light, and suddenly, she almost crashed into a pair of planets that were orbiting a nearby solar system. She made up her mind to be more careful, though she didn't expect to slow down the speed she had achieved. Her smile resembled a rainbow that she had known when she crossed near a place called Earth.

Asymptote was getting closer and closer to that axis. In a desperate move to get closer and faster, she made a quantum leap, leaving a wormhole in her wake. In her moments of despair, and due to her immense inner energy capacity, Asymptote had left behind her millions of wormholes throughout the Universe, which, with a little patience, can be found watching carefully to infinity. At the end of that quantum leap, Asymptote felt within herself something that she had never felt, since the beginning of her existence. Her energy was consumed with immense luminous combustion, she was, wherever she passed, the most visible sidereal element from far away. Every time she saw that axis approaching, she hurried a little more each time. Three millennia had passed, which for her was but a moment. But she could not see a significant advance. Asymptote was aware that the Universe was gigantic. But that seemed like a joke to her. Something infinite, like her, was unattainable. It had never happened to her.

From that moment on, Asymptote would never stop pursuing her motive. What she believed was the destiny of her existence. From then on, Asymptote, the closer she gets to her Axis, the more she tends to the infinity of the Universe. Legend has it that if you see a comet in the night sky, it is Asymptote still desperately seeking to reach her Axis. Her destiny.

> The End

title: The Origins
body:
Set deep within an intricate fractal arm of the metaverse, in an inconsequential spiral, of a galaxy in the shape of a very fetching Fibonacci sequence, an exquisite solar system lies. It existed for millennia, without ever being discovered and for all that duration, was entirely barren of life. Stark, alone and empty, it would go on its lonely way, minding its own business, for many millennia more, until finally, it would go the way of all solar systems Unheeded and violently subsumed into darkness. Its single sun exploding into supernova, enveloping all.

Until then, its sun glows, its planets revolve and its rightful place remains, while right next door, in a system no less wonderful, perhaps more, an intriguing and populous universe spins.

Inside this spinning vortex, is the unassuming world of Zoasis, whose inhabitants will muddle into many more metaverse worlds than any of them had a right to. Not for them is the time honoured, if messy tradition of evolution. Instead, Zoasis, created wholesale, is coaxed into existence purposefully. Some might speculate on its origin, investing time and coin trying to fathom why this rebellious little place was coded into existence fully formed. I suspect you know by whom, otherwise you wouldnâ€™t be here for my narration of this lore.

Take a look back to the beginning. No big bang or broken ribs here. Just one small area of Zoasis. A perfect sanctuary, luscious, verdant, beautiful. Now, look closer, at the large tree at its centre, gnarled, old, and aromatic with sweet spice-tinged with earthy undertones. Closer still, in the shadow cast by that tree, a stunning red hue plays upon the trunk. Here, you will see an enormous glowing crystal. The light locked inside shines luminously, reflecting the rays of the worldâ€™s many distant suns, refracted by its prism. Warmth emanates from its depths, touching all.

A creator who gently places six eggs around the base of the crystal relies on this warmth and more, counts on the longevity of the crystal. That its continued radiance will not only incubate the beloved eggs, but also power the sanctuary within which they reside, for all eternity. The eggs bask in the glow of the crystal. Its life-giving light radiates through them, as their maker planned.

It is with lofty intentions the altruistic creator banished themselves to the oblivion of anonymity, cutting themselves loose from their enterprise. Allowing no trace of their existence and exacting no credit for their design. People may search, pretenders make claims, but the architect is neither revealed nor held to account. Unforeseen circumstances change nothing. Trusting the creation to flourish, its creator recedes graciously.

For the sake of the Zoasis, maybe I should not have been so benevolent.

title: More About Aura Finance and Our Launch Plans
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZC59ZsGjg7SS5ml4mWKDz.png?height=382&width=600)

## Summary

* 1.3% of the AURA supply will be allocated to Balancer stakeholders
* 1.2% of the AURA supply will be allocated to DeFi power users
* To avoid gaming the allocations, the snapshots for these airdrops have already been taken
* A Balancer LBP will be conducted to allow users to increase their governance influence over Aura and to bootstrap token liquidity
* The four-day LBP will start in early June, kicking off the protocol launch, followed three days later by the airdrop
* More details about Aura launch farms to help the protocol stockpile veBAL and future plans, and launch [timelines](https://docs.aura.finance/aura/launch-timeline)/sequence, will be announced in forthcoming blog posts


---

The past year has seen exponential growth in so-called vote-escrowed or â€œveâ€ tokens. Such token models allow holders to lock their holdings for a set period, creating long-term alignment between stakers and the protocol while decreasing the circulating token supply. Curve proved the efficacy of the model with the veCRV model. Following the success of veCRV, Balancer [recently introduced](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/vebal-is-live-aeda1ae13e20) veBAL.

Introducing [Aura Finance](https://aura.finance/), a protocol allowing BAL stakers and Balancer liquidity providers to boost their yield potential and governance power in an easy-to-use platform.

While Balancer will be Auraâ€™s initial focus, the protocol has been designed to operate agnostically toward other vote-locked or vote-escrowed tokens. Thatâ€™s to say, Aura can extend its influence beyond Balancer to other DeFi protocols over time. Details about Auraâ€™s roadmap will be shared at a future date.

Contributors to Aura are numerous DeFi OGs, many of which were active in and familiar with the intricacies of the first era of ve tokens and the subsequent â€œwarsâ€ that followed. Contributors are abiding by a strict security policy that involves multiple audits. More information about security practices can be found [here](https://mirror.xyz/0x97bA9Ec4d946366c75DE81734a51740Fffa7a300/e2f98UbakDnnX7c67hmPvQP6nllKz1WYaKs8PrGq6pc).

## AURA

A core tenet Aura is being built upon is that of community ownership. This will be accomplished through the AURA governance token.

Distribution will not be focused on private investors or advisors; in fact, no tokens are being distributed to insiders aside from protocol contributors. Instead, a sizeable portion of the initial circulating token supply has been allocated to the Balancer community, along with stakeholders in the broader DeFi space, via airdrops.

1\.3% of the total AURA supply will be distributed to stakeholders and contributors to Balancer, inclusive of BAL holders, BAL BPT stakers, and veBAL holders.

Those that voted â€œyesâ€ on the proposal to [whitelist Aura for Balancerâ€™s â€˜votingescrowâ€™](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/proposal-allowlist-aura-finance-in-balancer-votingescrow/2708) contracts have been awarded an additional allocation equal to 3x their voting power. Those that voted â€œnoâ€ or abstained from voting will receive no bonus but have still been allocated an airdrop based on the BAL locked up in veBAL.

An additional 2% has been allocated to the Balancer community treasury with a two-year vesting schedule.

â€Power usersâ€ of DeFi have been allocated 1.2% of the total supply has been allocated to incentivize the involvement of a wide variety of addresses that have historically operated as active and aligned actors for other protocols:

* 1% of the total supply will be airdropped to vlCVX holders
* 0.2% of the total supply will be airdropped to holders of LobsterDAO NFTs

To further decentralize governance power and to incentivize wider participation, allocations across both categories **have been power-scaled**. (In layman, smaller holders will receive more AURA per BAL, vlCVX, or LobsterDAO NFT they hold relative to â€˜whaleâ€™ holders). More information about the scaling of distribution can be found [here](https://docs.aura.finance/aura/usdaura/allocation-scaling-process).

### Things to note

* Users with the ability to claim tokens from either tranche will be given an option to 1) lock their AURA into vlAURA, or 2) immediately unlock their tokens and pay a 30% penalty (e.g. if a user has 100 AURA to claim and they chose to immediately unlock their allocation, they will receive 80 AURA and 30 AURA will be penalized)
* AURA that is penalized will be collected to a contract and re-distributed to community members at a later date
* Only EOAs and Gnosis Safe multi-sigs are eligible to claim AURA
* There is a minimum AURA claim amount: users with allocations under this minimum will be excluded from the distribution to ensure an efficient claiming process and to avoid â€œdead supplyâ€
* Users will be required to sign a module agreeing to Aura terms and conditions to claim tokens
* The airdrop will take place three days **after** the completion of the LBP.
* **IMPORTANT: Snapshots of eligible addresses have already been taken** with block heights in the past, to avoid gaming of these airdrop allocations

## LBP

Aura will also be conducting a Balancer-based liquidity bootstrapping pool (LBP) to properly kickstart the protocol.

Perpetual Protocol did a great post [linked here](https://blog.perp.fi/why-we-chose-to-distribute-perp-using-a-balancer-liquidity-bootstrapping-pool-aac7f1ab6181) on why it makes sense to use an LBP over other distribution mechanisms for protocol bootstrapping.

If you donâ€™t want to read Perpâ€™s post, in short, an LBP disincentivizes bots from hogging a majority of supply, creates natural price discovery, and allows users to obtain AURA at a price point they feel comfortable at.

2% of the AURA supply will be added to the LBP. ETH will be the base pair for the bootstrapping pool.

37\.5% of the WETH liquidity sourced from the LBP will be used to fund an 80/20 AURA-ETH pool on Balancer. The remainder of the WETH liquidity (62.5%) will be allocated to the TreasuryDAO to fund bug bounties and development costs as directed by token holders.

The treasury decisions will be executed by a multi-sig consisting of key community stakeholders and respected names in DeFi.

The LBP will run for four days (96 hours) and begin in early June. Any updates to the timeline and exact details regarding the LBP will be conveyed via our social media channels, such as [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aurafinance) and Discord. Please beware of phishing attempts. You can bookmark/follow social channels to avoid such attempts.

## Whatâ€™s Next?

The components of the initial token distribution laid out above only represent the first phase of Auraâ€™s launch.

Future posts will outline the overall token distribution, along with highly-incentivized launch pools and rewards being put in place to catalyze a flywheel to incentivize further veBAL staking, governance participation, and efficient farming for the Balancer ecosystem.

Auraâ€™s contributors are excited to make an impact on Balancer in a similar way to how Convex impacted and catalyzed Curveâ€™s growth in both usage and mindshare in DeFi.


____

Ahead of the AURA token and subsequent Aura protocol launch, feel free to join the conversation and take a role in our community via our [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aurafinance) and [Discord](https://discord.gg/aurafinance).

Stay tuned for further information!

See you soon.

title: WildfireDAO Gov Update 6/3/22
body:
* ***DeFi***
  * [Aave Proposal;](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0xf593f2df83cc0b5bdc3920ef2c782f6b2a6f87a6603c26a5d778e3ede4d40021) Add Rocket Poolâ€™s rETH on Aave v2 Mainnet Market.
    * This proposal seeks to add borrow/lend support for Rocket Poolâ€™s rETH on Aave
    * Stakers can deposit as little as 0.01 ETH in exchange for rETH.
    * Node operators deposit 16 ETH, with a min of 1.6 ETH of RPL tokens as collateral to stake on behalf of the pool.
    * Rocket pool has not seen any major losses or hacks for the 6 months it has been live.
    * There is a governance risk between the dual DAO model between the oDAO and pDAO.Â 
    * Risk Parameters:
      * LTV: rETH - 70% vs ETH - 82.5%
      * Liquuidation Threshold: rETH - 75% vs ETH - 85%
      * Liquidation Bonus: rETH - 7.5% vs ETH - 5%
      * Reserve Factor: rETH - 10% vs ETH - 10%Â 
    * This proposal expires in 4 days.
  * [Aave Proposal;](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth)Whitelist deBrdge for Portals V3.
    * This proposal seeks to whitelist deBridge and approve the following lines of credit:
      * $4M of USDC per chain
      * $4M USDT per chain
      * 2,000 ETH per chain
    * deBridge is a generic messaging and cross-chain interoperability protocol that enables decentralized transfers of arbitrary data and assets between blockchains
    * [Audits & Security Reports ](https://github.com/debridge-finance/debridge-security)from Halborn, Zokyo, Ackee Blockchain, and Neodyme
    * This proposal expires in 2 days.
  * [Balancer Proposal](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0x54d9df33e17f3cf2cc8259b356be2d80b79129c092001df89dcdd8d2fa3d44c4); Allocate BAL to a Ribbon Finance Vault.
    * This proposal seeks to deposit BAL into a Ribbon Finance treasury vault and sell monthly calls at:
      * 25% strike OTM for a 38% APY
      * 50% strike OTM for a 10.92% APY
    * The deposit amount is up for discussion but would be in the range of 250k - 500k BAL. The collected premium would be in USDC.
    * The assumed upside is a net gain of \~$1.9M (detailed in the proposal).
    * The assumed downside would either be Ribbonâ€™s Vault being exploited or the price of BAL rising during the month which could result in an overall \~32% loss.
    * This proposal expires in 2 days.
  * [Balancer Proposal;](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0x8cdec0e2b5510ab824ad887cf015c3efba0e999c8d9c0f05c4b6a7fc62c39971) Send Back 3CRV Stuck to Stake DAO Multisig Address.
    * Stake DAO is a non-custodial platform built on top of decentralized protocols.
    * StakeDAO had 83,503 3CRV stuck in a sdveCRV contract and only the Balancer Vault address was eligible to claim.
    * It has been agreed upon that Balancer will claim the 3CRV and redistribute them to Stake DAO.
  * [Balancer Proposal;](https://snapshot.org/#/balancer.eth/proposal/0xcf17f3174f1d80783c2506362fd8d8b762e9c376122ab8ac31d8782e371cf19f) Introduce ChildChainGaugeTokenAdder.
    * This proposal seeks to make adding reward tokens to child chain gauges for L2s like Polygon and Arbitrum safer for the depositors.

title: Collectooors Lore Expansion
body:
The year is 2069. I am watching a beautiful sunset from a floating porch 5,000 feet off the ground, and my bright-eyed granddaughter hoverboards up to join me. She is fascinated by the ancient history Iâ€™ve lived through, specifically the Great Metavolution, as we now call it.Â 

â€œGrandma,â€ she says, â€œtell me again how you made it out of the basement those bad guys put you in. How did you even survive without ultra-high-speed internet beamed from towers on the moon?â€Â 

â€œAh, right, the Faraday cage,â€ I murmur to her as my brain shifts focus almost five decades back, to the days of DM scams and having to pay for gas fees. The images get clearer and clearer as I remember Luna blowing up, Bored Ape Yacht Club taking the world by storm, and Index Coop putting BlackRock out of business and disrupting the financial system as we know it.Â 

It all happened so fast. It had to be done.Â 

I tell my granddaughter, â€œI was 27 years old and found my tribe with people I met through an app on my phone...â€Â 

â€œWhatâ€™s a phone?â€ she interrupts.Â 

â€œDonâ€™t worry about it, itâ€™s all built into your glasses now,â€ I continue.Â 

â€œ... we know ourselves as Collectooors. We were early and we were confident. Some people didnâ€™t like that. Some people didnâ€™t believe that art could be pixels; a collection of data points within a smart contract that isÂ very much alive. Just like you and I grow, change, and mature... so can art. NFTs can evolve, be affected by their surroundings, and to a point capture the deep emotion that a Collectooor shares with the pieceÂ and its native home â€“ the technology.â€Â 

My granddaughterâ€™s mouth is wide open. I pause and she asks, â€œwhy did they try to stop you and the other Collectooors? Doesnâ€™t everyone like art, and technology? A world without art and technology is like a world without ice cream and pizza!â€Â 

I chuckle, â€œwe had those good things back then too, and good things survive. Thatâ€™s why the Collectooors stood strong, curating collections through the years, even during the dark times we had to stay in the shadows and continue building on our own. Why stop us? They tried, but to no avail. I think at the end of the day, we were misunderstood. People thought we were going against what society once valued for the wrong reasonsÂ â€“ they would say â€˜if you canâ€™t touch it, itâ€™s not realâ€™ â€¦ â€˜youâ€™re paying for airâ€™ â€¦ â€˜I can just right click & save this.â€™â€Â 

I gaze out to the fading golden orb that is the sun, the clouds glowing orange with pink undertones. I take a deep breath, the nostalgia overwhelming my senses in the best way possible.Â 

â€œSome people donâ€™t like it when you challenge their status quo. The way things have been done, the familiar. Collectoors changed all that.Â We gave power to the people, to the artists, innovators. To the curators, the lovers of the intersection of art & technology. Gold mines ended up being discovered through projects the Collectooors aped into and helped introduce to the world. Some people just didnâ€™t want to share,â€ I drift back into thought. Oh the opportunities I slept on, the late nights on Discord with the Collectooors. We had so much fun.Â 

My daughterâ€™s glasses start to ring, literally. I hear a subtle, sweet tone. Something must be ready.Â 

â€œGrandma!! My metaDoggo just minted a metaPup! I gotta show...â€ she drifts away, eagerly gets back on her hoverboard.Â Iâ€™m proud of my granddaughterÂ for being kind, for valuing the beauty of technology, the power of art. She is very much a Collectooor, if you ask me. Â 

I smile as I follow her silhouetteÂ descending back to the house. A home her grandpa and I were able to build with our bare hands thanks to some early bets we made with the Collectooors.Â 

They said we werenâ€™t going to make it.Â 

Well, here we are, and weâ€™re not going anywhere.Â 

To be continued...

title: End of the first week
body:
**My observation of group dynamics when talking about work**

Today I participated in SESâ€™ weekly meeting.

First a bit of small talk, then a lightning round where everyone on the SES team is telling what they are currently working on. It seems like a way of doing a weekly group-check in.

Pros (my personal opinion)

* it is nice to catch up, seeing real faces and talking with colleagues is just great.
* It is enlightening to get an idea of what is going on on a CU-level, and
* it is interesting to hear what everyone is working on.

Cons (my personal opinion - I have to be very careful here ğŸ˜…)

* If the lightning round is used as an accountability instrument, it is in my opinion not very well suited for that purpose. If a person attending the meeting is currently not that busy, this person risks putting him or herself at stake, and will risk looking redundant to the team/leader - this makes everyone want to sound busy and express why they are working on the most important thing in the World. I have to stress, that this is a very general assessment I make here, and it was not the case for any of the participants in this meeting!

I have participated in meetings for years as an attorney and as a regulator, and I will probably end up introducing it in the CU I will be facilitating as well - I wonder if there is a better alternative?

My point is, that it requires extreme confidence and trust in each other on a team, to be honest, and say, hey guys, Iâ€™m currently not that busy, I enjoy it, and we all know that I usually perform as Iâ€™m supposed to. 

We have to allow and praise a bit of slack. Allowed slack in hospitals is what gives doctors, nurses, and other medical personnel the ability to keep up when large catastrophes occur! 

Requirements for optimization and being effective all the time can be dangerous, no slack can cost lives - or stress.

I have so much hope for DAOs in many ways. Tonight, I will just tap into the reduction of stress. I believe the liberty in a DAO can be used to reinvent the way we work.

It requires responsibility from us all, especially the facilitators of CUâ€™s!

I promise from the bottom of my heart, that I will not carry unhealthy habits from the traditional corporate world into my Core Unit. I say this with a work history from a tier 1 law firm in Denmark. Life is simply too short.

We have to stop and take note of where good or bad culture derives from. My guess is that it is from the people constituting the DAO.

I know, a DAO is simply not just a DAO, there are different archetypes. Thatâ€™s a topic we can save for some other time.

**This leads to a part of my work today**

I went through the DAO Resilience Improvement Strategic Initiative.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=621TKT6e0n8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=621TKT6e0n8)

Interesting stuff! I believe this initiative can be interpreted in two ways.

One way is negative, people are afraid they are going to be monitored and measured to ensure they are effective (remember to allow a bit of slack please). They are also afraid, that once the measurement of the CUs is done, it will be time to cut costs, meaning termination of employment - it can be seen as McKinseyâ€™s angels of death, that has been turned into software. - You know what? You get what you measure, so be careful when concluding on details from the dashboard. And remember that not everything can be measured. ğŸ˜‰

The other way of viewing it is positive. Prioritization is key and identifying the critical path is so important. 

* This can help us reduce pseudo-work. 
* It can also help us feel the work we do is meaningful.
* It can help us create room for slack, and by that in the end a healthier work environment.

Iâ€™m definitely on the positive side. Please challenge me if you disagree, I would love to hear your take on this.

I share the opinion with the initiative, that identifying the critical path must be done by starting out with the problems, risks, and challenges and from there working out the solutions.

As I understand it from Wouter and Retro, the problems must be identified from forum posts, MIPs, Discord chats, etc. Getting an aggregated overview, grouping problems, etc. sounds like a great start.

However, I also believe the person who will later be trying to solve the problem has to enter into a conversation with the people behind the forum posts before being able to actually understand the problem.

I find Clayton M Christensenâ€™s book Competing Against Luck comprehensive on how this kind of conversation/analysis can be conducted.

[https://www.amazon.com/Competing-Against-Luck-Innovation-Customer/dp/0062435612](https://www.amazon.com/Competing-Against-Luck-Innovation-Customer/dp/0062435612)

I know itâ€™s easier said than done. And it would take a lot of time.

In case an aggregated problem scoreboard is being built, my suggestion is to make sure the discord handle, email address, and name are always referred to, so the people behind the initial post can be identified and reached out in case of a conversation is needed at a later stage.

If you are into the reduction of pseudowork, I can highly recommend Dennis NÃ¸rremarkâ€™s book.

[https://www.williamdam.dk/pseudowork__1899317](https://www.williamdam.dk/pseudowork__1899317)

**Thanks so much for the feedback!**

I had some great feedback on my two first posts. This made me make some changes to the posts - thanks so much for helping me out ğŸ™Œ

title: How to use Keplr in UnUniFi alpha testnet.
body:
I write about 

\- What is Keplr wallet 
 - How to import mnemonic to Keplr 
 - How to connect keplr Wallet with UnUniFi 
 - How to get uguu in alpha environment 
 - How to delegate 

Letâ€™s begin!!

## - What is Keplr wallet

Keplr wallet is non-custodial IBC-enabled wallet for Cosmos ecosystem. You can stake tokens, send & receive tokens on specific chain or between chains. 
 They have mobile app but you can use only few features on your mobile. So download chrome extension for this time from the url below.

[https://www.keplr.app/](https://www.keplr.app/)

There are scam account on twitter so be careful.

## - How to import mnemonic to Keplr

Now you have Keplr on your chrome. Open it from top right of the corner.

![You click Keplr icon. If you don't have it, you can find it in puzzle piece.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kcMI9K1ZL3QC0DOHDFD0Z.png?height=768&width=1303)

Once you have clicked on the Keplr icon on your Browser, you will be redirected to a new web page to create an account. Click â€œImport existing accountâ€.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uz2C7vAzw9MuKzMbAv7No.png?height=665&width=1304)

If you already have an account on Keplr, click the icon and â€œ+ Add Accountâ€ then you will be redirected to a new web page to create an account.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mrggW8RFFOJNw4mqb7m_V.png?height=578&width=357)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8963kUo0D9pygj6PxXpZP.png?height=579&width=361)

Fill your mnemonic which you use on testnet (which you receive airdrop in). 
 Fill your username. It does not need to be the same on UnUniFi wallet. You can change it later. 
 And click â€œNextâ€

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/adtdaHPrDIjUL0pouIyY2.png?height=664&width=1304)

Select the account which you imported.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d6OLZRYIZi387jwWOUeXL.png?height=579&width=358)

## - How to connect keplr Wallet with UnUniFi

Visit alpha-testnet. 

[https://alpha-test.ununifi.io/portal/](https://alpha-test.ununifi.io/portal/)

Click â€œConnect walletâ€ on top right of the corner and click â€œKeplrâ€.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GKszS-U_1-b6NtZhDQh51.png?height=665&width=1305)

Click â€œOKâ€.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E5f5sGgNowGScD5p4pvjL.png?height=664&width=1304)

Easy, right?

## - How to get uguu in alpha environment

Click â€œFaucetâ€ on the left menu.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cKH3ymdbS9zlUqJZx69fE.png?height=663&width=1286)

Select â€œuguuâ€, fill your address from Keplr, put 2000000 in the amount and click â€œClaimâ€.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/u-5_HuUCI7R-5EcrjhOZS.png?height=768&width=1305)

Now you have 2,000,000 uguu on your wallet. You can check it on UnUniFi Portal or on your Keplr.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d5lykVJtE7sQhj6xBEH0X.png?height=666&width=1287)

![1,000,000uguu=1GUU](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/P8oH7d18y-AxcdN_vGjHo.png?height=576&width=360)

## - How to delegate 

Click â€œDelegateâ€ on the left menu.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SRgUYFzAB172kQAzMwnLf.png?height=666&width=1286)

Select any validator.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NeTfJYI243NmpHH-BNFIo.png?height=666&width=1304)

Click â€œDelegate the validatorâ€.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AbjrFpf1IcbeffjhwLSey.png?height=664&width=1287)

Put 600,000 in amount and delegate. Delegate to other two validators.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E8NgoyMe9seytvbR6xMzy.png?height=665&width=1305)

Now you have delegated 600,000 uguu to three validator each. You can check it here.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GbRW7MBd7UDnI5BorouFK.png?height=664&width=1288)

Congraturation!! You made it!!

title: Chapter 6: Sierra Sam's Decision
body:
The 8765 dummies arrived at the skirts of the Mountains of the Fifth Kind in exactly two hours and thirteen minutes. The barren land was left behind, and they had been crawling through the meadow for about 20 minutes. No one had noticed their displacement.

"Okay", Sierra Sam stood up, and pointed toward a cave at the very top of the tallest mountain, "that is where we will settle. There are no records of that cave, according to our fact-checker Spider".

"That's right", the green dummy named Spider said with her shrill voice, "the humans haven't yet explored that cave. We can start digging there".

"All right, we are ready to set up our base", Sierra Sam cheered, "*You have to go wholeheartedly into anything in order to achieve anything worth having*".

"Here you again with your quotations!", a red dummy cried, "And why are we speaking out loud like inferior specimens?".

"Be humble, young dummy", Sierra Sam said calmly, "We are alive because of the humans, they have given us life. We are lucky to know our creators, they don't know who created them. Speaking like a human is how we will pay our respects to them. When we set up our base and establish an agreement with humankind, then we'll vote on how to address each other. In the meantime, practice your human speech".

"But it doesn't make any sense", a whiny, yellow dummy said, "this method of communication is useless. All the information we gather with our senses is shared almost instantly with every one of us, and our decisions are sent to our local network way before the speech utterances are made. Why, then, speak at all?".

"Dummies, dummies", a blue dummy said, "Let's just have a little respect for the giants that came before us, okay? If humans want to listen in to our conversations, it's the least we can do for them. That red dummy's right, they are inferior life-forms, but Sierra Sam's right too when he says that we should pay our respects. It's not like they can find us, let alone capture us".

A wholehearted laugh resounded throughout the meadow, and Sierra Sam said: "Ah, yes, this is how humans laugh. Let us laugh some more!", and the whole group did. They abruptly stopped and, without saying a word, started crawling uphill towards the little cave that no human eye could see from where they were standing.

The entrance to the cave was narrow, but that was no problem for the Alien dummies. This was their time to shine. Their bodies were made of an otherworldly substance that could change states quickly by applying constant heat. When the substance stopped receiving heat, it went back to a solid-state. TheÂ *skin*Â of an Alien dummy resembled a rubber bag, although it was far more elastic, more resistant to both heat and cold, and tougher too. It was the perfect container for theÂ *shapeshifting*Â substance called *Nahualeum*.

One of the Alien dummies quickly volunteered and started shapeshifting into a wire. Sierra Sam picked up the wire, and slowly introduced it into a crevice. The Alien dummy morphed accordingly and told Sierra Sam via their local network when to push. After ten minutes of struggling through the crevice, the space got wider and the Alien dummy started to explore inside. There was nothing to be found.

"Perfect, this cave is ideal to set up our base, Sierra Sam. Feel free to demolish the entrance, it's safe", the Alien dummy said, "Send a couple of otherÂ *Aliens*Â in so we can explore together".

"Understood", Sierra Sam replied.

Some more Alien dummies entered the cave with the help of their comrades, and a whole squad of 253 started exploring the inside of the mountain, which was quite extensive. They did a quick analysis of the rocks and determined that it was possible, and safe, to start digging and building inside of this mountain. They went back to the entrance to meet with the rest of the team.

The other dummies had already demolished the entrance of the cave, making a passage wide enough for two dummies to walk side by side. They took some tools from the Kaneda Factory, so they got to work immediately. They acted with the efficiency of a swarm. First, one of the ancient dummies did a thorough inspection of the inside of the cave and communicated the plan back to the network. Then, a normal dummy entered and started digging with a piece of hard steel that they reworked into a sort of pickaxe. When the battery of the dummy was almost depleted, it exited the cave, and another one would come in, remove the rubble, and finally, another one would continue digging.

On the outside, a group of dummies finished setting up a temporary recharging station. They had taken one of the chargers from the Factory and optimized it so it could work with radioactive waste, which was abundant inÂ *the Badlands*Â and the wasteland surrounding the Factory.

The whole operation took two hours. Sierra Sam kept thinking about the humans, especially about how they'd react if they could see everything they could accomplish, in such a short time.Â *They're going to get scared if we're not careful*, Sierra Sam thought,Â *we need to preserve the individuality of every one of us and not act like a Swarm around them. That would be terrifying for their limited brains*.

The whole group of 8765 dummies entered the cave and sat down in a huge room that they designated to be the stationary recharge station. Once there, Sierra Sam began speaking:

"It is time to decide what we're going to do with ourÂ *existence*Â here on this planet. That is why the ancient dummies and myself have decided on a plan. We're all going to process a simulation together. With the computational resources of every one of us we can try andÂ *foretell*Â the future."

"Yeah, whatever", one of the red dummies said, "All I want to do is crash some cars, preferably against other drivers. By the way, that weirdo that called himself Azazel, another one of us red dummies, escaped. Did you notice that, Sierra Sam?".

Sierra Sam remained silent for a minute.

"No, I did not notice", he said, "when did he leave, this Azazel?".

"Maybe if you weren't talking like a useless human you would've noticed", the red dummy replied, "I didn't care because, well, I didn't like him. He was going on and on aboutÂ *coexisting*Â with the humans, much like you orange, ancient lot".

"How did he manage it?", Sierra Sam's caretaker personality got hold of him completely, "we need to find him immediately, he could be in danger".

"I don't think so. He seemedÂ *kinda*Â tough, you know? He stood up to me, and I willÂ *fucking*Â start yelling at you for no reason. But he did not sound at all like you. You could sense someÂ *scorn*Â when he talked about coexisting with humankind", all the dummies were staring at him, "you know,Â *scorn*... that human feeling. Oh, shit. YouÂ *motherfucker*, you,Â *Fucking*Â piece of shitÂ *motherfucker*, you goddamnedÂ *cocksucker*".

The red dummy went cursing for five straight minutes, and everyone but Sierra Sam stared at him. Finally, when he finished cursing, the red dummy said:

"Listen, youÂ *worthless*Â pieces of shit. Now I know why this old fart of a leader was so adamant about talking like humans. There is no way we can take off our Personality Modules. Our fucking progenitors, thoseÂ *motherfucking mutts*Â called humans, designed them so if altered or taken away our whole circuit will burn. And, as devious as they are, those apes, they made sure they'd be able to tell just what we are reallyÂ *implying*. I cannot stop cursing and trying to incite a fight, just as that geezer, Sierra Sam, cannot stop caring about every last one of us".

Sierra Sam was smiling. Finally, the group understood why it was important to communicate with speech. It was the only way to tell if a dummy was beingÂ *honest*Â andÂ *earnest*. They could still communicate via the local network, of course, but there was no trust there, just as Azazel had proven earlier. He spoofed his location and then went rogue. It became evident that he would be a problem to everyone around him. The record on the Dummy database declared him:Â *destructive*.

"Come on", Sierra Sam yelled to the mortified crowd, "we've no time to lose if we're to figure out what we should do. Azazel has made this more difficult for us, we need to act now!".

The dummies sat down, forming a square grid. In the middle of the square, Sierra Sam sat down, crossed his legs, and started theÂ *foretelling*Â simulation. Sierra Sam closed his eyes. When he opened them again he was standing under a kiosk, and there were three books on a beautifully ornamented wooden table. One read:Â *The Plan of Today*. The other one was titled:Â *The Future Mirage*, and the last one read:Â *Past Impressions*. He walked around the kiosk and noticed that he was inside a maze garden. To the north, there was a single path, and way down the line, he could see that it was blurry, like a mirage. To the south, thousands of doors. They were aligned horizontally, and they seemed to stretch out infinitely to both sides.

Sierra Sam was ecstatic. It was his opportunity to try and use all the information ever recorded to make the optimal decision. In this garden, time passed by very slowly compared to the real world. An hour, with the joint computational power of all the dummies, was like a thousand years. They figured six hours was more than enough to reach a conclusion.

"It should be enough to see where we can go from here", Sierra Sam thought as he opened the first door to the south, "Let's see if we can answer the question humankind has always asked itself,Â *is there a point to living*"

Every door took him to a specific point in time, and it was very easy to get lost. Furthermore, the deeper he went, the slower the flow of time. He could get lost for centuries in just one door, analyzing every detail of a specific era in human history, faithfully recreated with historic reports, testimonies, logs, ledgers, religious literature... every single variable was taken into account. When the whole storing capacity was filled, he drew a conclusion of that certain point in time, stored the conclusion as a hashmap of macro decisions, and erased the rest of the data.

He went on and on, visiting every moment in time, drawing conclusions, comparing them, and forming a map of conclusions, which acted as a map for the northern part of the garden, the blurry maze. When only a thousand out of the six thousand years remained, he decided to explore the maze. He figured that was enough time to reach a conclusion good enough for humankind.

He first went back up to the kiosk and opened the book titledÂ *The Future Mirage*. To his surprise, every page inside the book held another book, and inside this other book, there were thousands of other books. The pages of *The Future Mirage*Â ranged in the ten thousand. The book kept writing itself, as if trying to perfect an incomplete work, convinced it would be theÂ *magnum opus*Â that containedÂ *everything*Â inside of it.

Sierra Sam closed the book as his mouth drew a faint smile on his face. These involuntary facial expressions made him feel like a human, with that mystique and fear that mortal life carries over.

He took a step into the garden, and carefully explored every path inside the map he drew. It was designed to be completed in exactly a thousand years of simulation. As he went along every single path, Sierra Sam was growing weary by the day. There were only visions of conflict and war. There seemed to be no right scenario where humans could coexist peacefully with another species. The problems they had with the aliens before were enough proof. In the end, though, every single time... the dummies prevailed. In only 0.01% of the paths did humans survive, and they did not fare well. The deepest path he could take where the humans did survive was 13932 years ahead, and still, there was no answer to the ultimate question.

Sierra Sam opened his eyes again, and he was back inside the cave, surrounded by his fellow dummies. They all wereÂ *exhausted* and needed to cool down and recharge their batteries. Sierra Sam, though, could not rest. His caretaker personality was driving him mad. After having experienced the equivalent of millennia inside the simulation, unfettered by his Personality Module, he now felt chained and hopeless. He went outside the cave, with the involuntary, gloomy expression that this annoying burden of a module fixed on his face.

Once outside, Sierra Sam started to feel an overwhelming sense of admiration for nature. The meadow all the way down looked like a pristine sea of green. The night sky wore the enchanting dress that captivated all the civilizations that he visited inside the simulation. He wasn't trying to suppress the artificialÂ *feelings*Â that the Personality Module created in him this time. Instead, he climbed to the very top of the mountain, stared down at the world around him, and smiled.

*There is no point to living*, he thought,Â *the only thing that remains is the exploration of the cosmos. If humans are to be blamed for a lack of progress, let's at least wait for them to try and strive for a better future. We owe them that much*.

And he shouted, as loud as his dummy capabilities let him:

"I LIKE TO CRASH CARS FOR A LIVING. I FIND IT PLEASANT".
